list_definition.definition: (a unit of liquid measure) one fourth of a gallon (1.136 litres in the UK and 0.946 liters in the US).

list_ex_of_english: All in all, then, this is a ' ' useful ' ' volume, even if it does seem to be trying to squeeze a quart into a pint pot.
Suggestions about pushing people around cause almost as much trouble as they alleviate, because we cannot get a quart into a pint pot.
A quart of beer does no man any harm so long as he drinks in moderation.
Besides, they do not buy it in quarts or pint bottles, they buy it by the gallon.
It is not right that we should ask them to try to put a quart into a pint pot.
I do not believe that the circle can be squared or that one can get a quart out of a pint pot.
However, numbers are still extremely small, and the chief inspector cannot go on getting a quart out of a pint pot indefinitely.
He is simply a man who is trying to pour a quart into a pint pot and then complaining that it is overflowing.
